item.title: PhD Thesis: Computational Models of Learning and Representations in the Hippocampal Formation
SIMPL: Scalable and hassle-free optimisation of neural representations from behaviour
item.description: An efficient technique for optimising tuning curves starting from behaviour by iteratively refitting the tuning curves and redecoding the latent variables.

item.title: Replay of procedural experience is independent of the hippocampus
item.description: We use an unsupervised sequence detection algorithm to demonstrate, for the first time, replay of procedural memories in the striatum and that this replay is hippocampus-independent.

item.title: Location
item.description: Professor Dr von Igelfeld's mailing and office addresses at the Institute of Romance Philology.

item.title: Office Hours
item.description: Schedule and location for Professor Dr von Igelfeld's office hours.

item.title: A generative model of the hippocampal formation trained with theta driven local learning rules
item.description: A model of the hippocampal formation where theta-band oscillations and local error-correcting Hebbian learning rules train weights it analagous to a wake-speel algorithm. This bioplausible hippocampal model replicates key cognitive functions including path integration.

item.title: RatInABox, a toolkit for modelling locomotion and neuronal activity in continuous environments
item.description: This paper documents and motivates the RatInABox package, used for modellign locomotion and neural activity.

item.title: Theta sequences as eligibility traces: A biological solution to credit assignment
item.description: This short paper demonstrates a symmetry between theta sequences and eligibility traces, potentially explaining how credit assignment is implemented in the brain.

item.title: Rapid learning of predictive maps with STDP and theta phase precession
item.description: We study how successor representations can be learned in a biologically plausible way by hippocampal neurons using STDP and theta phase procession.

item.title: Deep learning to infer eddy heat fluxes from sea surface height patterns of mesoscale turbulence
item.description: Convolutional neural networks are used to solve the problem of predicting heat fluxes in turbulent ocean flows. Published in Nature Communications.

item.title: Reservoir computing for unsupervised chunking of sequential data
item.description: We built a reservoir network architecture, based off Asabuki et al. (2018), which can chunk sequential data into meaningful segments without supervision.

item.title: What makes neurons picky
item.description: We train neural networks to solve multiple tasks simultaneously and study when and why individual neurons become selective or mixed-selective.

item.title: Unsupervised machine learning for data encoding applied to ovarian cancer transcriptomes
item.description: We use variational autoencoders to compressed ovarian cancer transcriptomes and extract genetic markers predictive of chemotherapy resistance.

item.title: Lectures at the Villa of Reduced Circumstances
item.description: This graduate course presents classical results in Romance philology.

item.title: Portugese Irregular Verbs
item.description: This book discusses Portugese irregular verbs in great details.

item.title: Profanity in Early Irish
item.description: This undergraduate course discusses profanity in Early Irish.
